ai.summary: Buffalo Hut is a 7.9 km moderate hike in the UK. The route follows a well-defined trail with varied terrain, offering light ascents, open countryside views, and a mix of grassy paths and occasional muddy or rocky sections.
ai.terrain_summary: The hike uses a well-marked path with varied surfaces: grassy fields, compact soil, and occasional mud. There are gentle to moderate elevation gains, along with a few rocky patches and uneven footing. Expect wet ground after rain and seasonal mud; no technical scrambling.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and be prepared for changing UK weather. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers. Stay on the marked path, bring a map or GPS, water, snacks, and a basic first aid kit. Let someone know your plan and expected return time. Be cautious on wet or muddy sections, and watch for livestock or barriers at gates.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing (including hat and gloves in colder seasons)
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late return)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly late March to early November) for milder conditions; winter hikes are possible but often wetter, colder, and with shorter daylight.

seo.title: Buffalo Hut – 7.9 km Moderate Hike in the UK
